Achieving net zero: Cutting costs and carbon with sustainable devices
Vital role of end-user devices – and employee behavior – in reducing enterprise emissions
In this point of view, our experts Greg Bentham and Alan Connolly explore how organizations can better understand and mitigate the impact of employee devices and behavior on their overall emissions, and why addressing their digital carbon footprint is so valuable.
Impact of employee devices on carbon footprint
With 92 percent of organizations aiming to achieve their net zero targets by 2040, leaders worldwide are seeking innovative ways to be sustainable and minimize carbon emissions. While data centers, vehicle fleets, and office spaces are often the primary focus, the carbon footprint of employee devices is frequently overlooked.
Consider this: most employees are equipped with at least one company device, regardless of their work location. As these devices move through their life cycle – from manufacturing to usage to decommissioning – they contribute to Scope 1, 2, and 3 emissions in various ways.
How to minimize the carbon footprint of your devices
Reducing the carbon impact of devices requires a comprehensive approach and a collective effort. Every decision you make throughout the device life cycle influences your carbon footprint. Here are some key considerations for shaping your sustainable devices strategy:
- Understand the impact of original equipment manufacturers (OEMs) on the carbon footprint of your devices.
- Choose suppliers with minimal carbon impact.
- Select a catalog of devices that aligns with your sustainability strategy.
- Build a circular economy for enterprise services.
Employee engagement: Your key to success
Your employees interact with their devices daily, making their engagement crucial to the success of your sustainability strategy. Incorporate devices as a central component of your sustainable workplace strategy.
Download the PoV to learn how to integrate sustainable practices into your device ecosystem effectively.
Contact us to learn more about how you can make more sustainable device choices and engage your workforce in your organization’s net zero strategy.
